Context:
The text provides information about the services and resources offered by George Brown College to its Indigenous community. Here are some factual information extracted from the text:

- Our team assists GBC's Indigenous community in navigating resources, providing information on college-wide activities, as well as other services such as counselling, cultural teachings and workshops.
- Students can access a place to meet students and study while having access to job postings, current event listings, technology and more at the student centres.
- Assistance options available to Indigenous students include grants, bursaries, scholarships and awards.
- George Brown College has a land acknowledgment statement made at the beginning of events to recognize the traditional territory upon which they are situated.
- Indigenous students are invited to self-identify to access services and can learn more about resources for the Indigenous community including child care, cultural and friendship centres, employment and training, government, health, legal issues, and MÃ©tis organizations.
- Students can sign up to be kept in the contact about application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours and more.
- The text includes contact information for George Brown College: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca and a link to their social media hub.
- The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice.

No specific program information was mentioned in the text.
